bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla } S.S.
To James Buckley, Sheriff of said County:

Whereas, Application has been made, pursuant to statute, to the Hon. E. P. Oliphant, Judge of teh U.S. District Court. 1st Judicial District, in said Territory, and an order granted for a writ of Habeas Corpus, for the body of W. M. Kiby, who, it is alleged, is unlawfully restrained of his liberty.

Therefore, in the name of the United States, you are commanded to have the body of the said W M. Kirby with the cause of his detention, forthwith before the Hon. E. P. Oliphant, at Chambers, the the City of Walla Walla, to do and receive what shall be ordered concerning him; and have then and there this writ.
Witness, the Hon. E. P. Oliphant, Judge, adn the seal of the Court, this 13th day of August, A.D., 1862.
W. M. Kirby vs. Territory of Washington

In obedience to the within writ I have here the body fo W. M. Kirvy arrested by me in Walla Walla County, after his escape from the custody of the proper officer of Nez Perce County, and now held by me in custody August 16th 1862
div1.ab: James Buckley Sheriff Walla Walla County
div1.p: In obedience to the written writ, I have here the body of W. M. Kirby arrested by me on the 13th just and now held in custody by me on a charge of homicide; said Kibry having, as I have been informed, and believe, escaped from S. Alexander, a constable at Louiston in Nez Perce county, said Kirby having been committed to said constable for safe keeping by E. B. Stone, a justice of the peace in and for said county on a charge of wilful and malicious homicide.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 16th day of August 1862
div1.ab: James Buckley Sheriff Walla Walla County
